name: feeble
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 weak and without energy, strength, or power: He was a feeble, helpless old man. The little lamp gave only a feeble light. Opposition to the plan was rather feeble.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
not physically strongweakShe was too tired and weak to finish the race. feebleMany of the pensioners were so feeble they had to be stretchered onto the ship.punyHe was puny as a child.weedyUK I was just this weedy guy who always had his head in a book.frailA frail, grey-haired lady walked slowly down the street.
See more results »
C2 not effective or good: a feeble joke/excuse
